entry.title: Re: There is already a handling unit * posted for GR with...
entry.content:
Go to SMQ2 in ERP, find the LUW from EWM for this delivery. Display the error text. You should still see the HU conflict message unless you have already cleaned up the HU in ERP.

If you have already deleted/archived the old HU in ERP, make sure it is really gone from HUMO and not assigned to any historical document. If you can’t delete it (archiving restrictions), the only safe fix is to repack in EWM into a different HU number and re‑trigger the GI message. Even though EWM shows GI posted, you can still use /SCWM/PRDO to unpack/repack into a new HU. Then use /SCWM/POST to re‑post the GI. This will create a new queue to ERP.

“Cancel not allowed” in ERP" is coming from SD because a billing document exists for the delivery. If the billing document is not yet posted to accounting and can be cancelled, reverse it via VF11, then reverse the GI in VL09. If the billing document is already posted and cannot be cancelled, you cannot reverse the GI in ERP.  You must instead fix the posting from EWM so that ERP receives a successful GI message.

If EWM says GI posted but ERP does not, you have a status mismatch. To fix:

Option 1: Cancel GI in EWM (/SCWM/POST → Reverse GI), repack into a new HU, then post GI again so the new queue posts cleanly in ERP.

Option 2: If reversal in EWM is blocked because ERP never posted GI, you can use the queue reset approach. In SMQ1 (EWM outbound), delete the bad LUW. Manually post the GI in ERP (VL02N/VL06O) after fixing the HU number. Then manually set the delivery to completed in EWM (via PPF action or status update).

Finally, and importantly, separate HU number ranges between EWM and ERP so old ERP HUs can never be reused in EWM. Train users not to attempt GI reversal in ERP for EWM‑managed deliveries — always reverse in EWM first.

entry.title: Re: Logic Cash Collection Tracker in Account Receivable O...
entry.content:
Hi @12345678901 

  1. The target amount in the Cash Collection Tracker is derived from the sum of all open invoices due from previous periods, invoices posted in previous periods but due in the selected period and new invoices both posted and due within the selected period. This total due receivables amount forms the collection target for the period you are analyzing.
  2. In regard to calculation of Actual and Target Figures in the Bar Chart:
  • Target figure represents the total receivables due for the selected period, as described above.
  • On the other hand, actual figure Reflects the amount collected during the selected period. It is the sum of payments received against these due invoices within the timeframe.

The bar chart visually compares the actual collections against the target to show collection performance and outstanding amounts.

For deeper technical details, SAP Note 3585697 explains field calculations and logic in the Cash Collection Tracker app.

Consult the references below for more details.

Analyzing the SAP Collections Management Process – Collection Manager

3474257 - Cash Collection Tracker - Accounts Receivable App ID F2925

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Unable to change PO subcontracting material component...
entry.content:
For information, those component lines are not stored in the same PO item table; they’re managed via the subcontracting BOM explosion logic and the function module ME_COMPONENTS_MAINTAIN. The BAPI doesn’t call that FM for changes, so even if you fill POCOMPONENTS and POCOMPONENTSX, the data is ignored, and the original values are returned.

As you might be knowing, subcontracting components are stored in EKPO/EKET for the main item and RESB for the exploded components. In ME22N, when you change the batch in the Components tab, the screen logic calls ME_COMPONENTS_MAINTAIN to update the RESB entry. BAPI_PO_CHANGE does not trigger this component‑maintenance logic; it only processes the main PO item structures. As a result, your changes to POCOMPONENTS are never applied.

You can try with ME_COMPONENTS_MAINTAIN. If you are in ECC or S/4HANA on‑premise/Private Cloud, you can:

  • Read the existing component data with ME_READ_COMPONENTS.
  • Modify the batch field (CHARG) in the component structure.
  • Call ME_COMPONENTS_MAINTAIN to update it.
  • Then call ME_PO_COMMIT or BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT.

This is essentially what ME22N does behind the scenes.

entry.title: Re: How to show CGST, SGST and IGST separately in Adobe F...
entry.content:
Hello @Sanjay_BS1 

You don’t need backend logic to split GST. The standard billing form SDBIL_CI_STANDARD_IN already receives the pricing components of the billing document, including tax conditions. You can display CGST / SGST / IGST separately by modifying the form layout and reading the relevant tax condition types from the pricing elements node.

Suggested approach for Public Cloud

Create a personalised copy of the form

Update Form Templates → copy SDBIL_CI_STANDARD_IN to YY1_… and download it for Adobe LiveCycle editing.

Assign your customised template via Output Parameter Determination (Billing Document) for country :-IN.

Bind CGST/SGST/IGST amounts in the template

Within Adobe, in the context of the template, utilise the Pricing Elements node condition-by-condition.

Sum amounts by condition type used for India GST in your pricing process for CGST, SGST, and IGST condition types

Display three totals (CGST, SGST, IGST) and keep the cumulative GST if needed.

Review your specific condition types in the pricing through Manage Prices, excluding Sales / Set Pricing minus Sales. Note that names may vary by project, so make sure you use the condition types that your tenant is using.

(Optional) Expose additional fields

If a field you need isn’t available in the form context, add it through Data Source Extensions and then rebind it in the template.

No BAdI or backend split is necessary in Public Cloud; all data is retrieved through the form’s data source, and you manage the presentation within the template.

You can make a Quick test

Manage Billing Documents → Output Items → Preview.

Validate item splits and header totals.

SAP useful References for public use

  • SAP Help – Maintain Form Templates (create/copy/edit form templates):
  • SAP Help – Output Parameter Determination (assign template for Billing Documents):
  • SAP Help – Data Source Extensions (expose extra fields to form context):
  • SAP Help – India (IN) – GST in Sales (overview of GST in SD pricing & tax)

Let me know if you need further information

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: ISO20022 Bank Statement format file not available

It is necessary to assign the ISO20022 for your respective House Bank. 
Refer to the below KBA for additional information, please:

KBA 2404564- Error Message 'An Exception was raised' when uploading an XML Bank Statement https://me.sap.com/notes/2404564

Regards,
Anderson

entry.title: Stock in transit with moving average in SAP S4HANA
entry.content:
Hello,

In our scenario, raw materials are received with a moving average price. Ownership transfers to us once the material is loaded onto the truck (per Incoterms), but delivery to our plant takes 1–2 weeks.

To reflect ownership without affecting the moving average price, we currently post a goods receipt in a virtual plant upon loading, and perform the actual MIGO receipt when the material arrives.

Is it possible in SAP S/4HANA to avoid creating a virtual plant and instead use movement types 107 (at loading) and 109 (at arrival) to achieve the same result without impacting the moving average price?

Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: CRforVS stuck forever on 13.0.26? (type initializer for CrystalDecisions.Shared.SharedUtils threw..)
entry.content:
Hi folks, please be patient if this is not the proper board and direct me to the correct one; thanks!

I have a serious problem with upgraded CrystalReports runtimes.
I upgraded VS from 2019 to 2022, CRforVS from 13.0.26 to 13.0.38, using the .exe right click run as administrator
I uninstalled CRforVS 2019 first, then uninstalled VS2019, then installed VS2022 then CRforVS 2022.
References in the project point to what seems the correct location for me (\\..\Win64_x64\dotnet\...).
The version in there is 13.0.38.5404 stamped 2025-05-27.

The application builds fine using debug/release x64. Test on that machine with CR works as well.

On target machines though, after uninstalling CRRuntime 13.0.26 and installing CRRuntime 13.0.38, we get "type initializer for CrystalDecisions.Shared.SharedUtils threw an exception".

If I uninstall 13.0.38 again, and re-install 13.0.26 - strange enough - it works fine.
I can do this over and over again; 13.0.26 will work, while 13.0.38 will throw the exceptions.

Things I tried:
- registering the DLLs manually in the development machine
- removing CRViewer control and replace it again from (new) toolbox
- re-installing VCRedist 15-22 .14
all to no avail.

Please advise on how to find and preferrably solve that problem.

Thanks,
André

entry.title: ‌🎩‌The Magic of Attributes in SAP IAS: Default vs Enrich Assertion
entry.content:
✨🪄 Revellio 🪄✨

                                                                                                      🌟🔮🧙‍♀️🪄✨🧝‍♂️🌟

                                                        “ Unveiling the secrets of Identity Federation, one step at a time…”

✨🧙‍♂️ Unlocking SAP IAS Attribute Magic: Default vs Enrich Secrets Revealed 🎩

About Me

Hare Krishna 🙏 I am an SAP BTP Cloud Architect sharing practical insights, solutions, and real-world experiences from the SAP ecosystem.

🌟Introduction

When integrating SAP SaaS products on BTP, managing user attributes becomes a big challenge. Every app expects something slightly different—from hardcoded values to custom claim names. Without IAS, you'd have to tame these discrepancies in every corporate IdP or app individually, which isn't sustainable.

🔑IAS centralizes this with:

  1. 🟦 Default Attributes

  2. 🟩 Enrich Assertion Attributes

  3. ⚙️Identity Federation controls which method is applied

📘Concepts: When Which Mechanism Applies

Default vs. Enrich Assertion Attributes

SAP IAS provides two methods to control how attributes are sent to applications:

1. 🟦 Default Attributes

  • Configured at the application level inside IAS.

  • Can be static (hardcoded), pulled from IAS user store, or derived.

  • ✅Used when Identity Federation is enabled.

2. 🟩 Enrich Assertion Attributes

  • Configured in the corporate IdP connection inside IAS.

  • Uses values from the upstream IdP, with transformation before sending to apps.

  • ✅Used when Identity Federation is disabled.
    (📄 Official Doc)

🔄Identity Federation in IAS

Identity Federation decides whether IAS acts as the authoritative IdP 🆔 or a proxy 🔀:

  • Federation Enabled

    • IAS processes 🟦 Default Attributes.

    • Useful even when using corporate IdP—IAS can inject hardcoded values like Groups = sac.

  • Federation Disabled

    • IAS functions as a pass-through proxy.

    • Only 🟩 Enrich Assertion Attributes are active, customizing only based on the upstream IdP data.
      (📄 Reference)

💡This flexibility ensures SAP SaaS tools always receive what they expect—without demanding changes in your corporate IdP or each app.

🌟How IAS Helps Customers

Setting up SSO for SAP SaaS apps can be tricky—each service has its own attribute requirements. Without IAS, you’d constantly tweak your corporate IdP or each app.

With Default and Enrich Assertion Attributes, IAS provides a centralized layer to standardize attributes once and reuse across apps.

🔑Real-World Scenarios(few examples)

SAP ServiceRequiredHow IAS helps
Datasphere / SAC 📊Groups = sacA retail company can inject this via Default Attribute to authorize analysts without changing Azure AD groups.
Signavio 🟧signavio_groupsA manufacturing firm maps workspace groups via Enrich Assertion when federation is off, or as Default Attribute when federation is on—no IdP restructuring needed.
Kyma Runtime 🌀Groups as groupsA tech startup transforms incoming Group claims from Okta to groups for app provisioning without any code changes.
SAP BTP Services 🔷firstname, lastname, emailA logistics company ensures consistent user attributes from IAS or upstream IdP for automated user provisioning.

💡Customer Value

  • Less Customization: Corporate IdPs remain clean; no per-app hacks.

  • Faster Rollouts: Onboard new SAP tools quickly.

  • Compliance & Governance: Centralized attribute control improves auditability.

  • Flexibility: Hardcode, map, or enrich attributes depending on SaaS needs—without breaking federation.

Whether it’s Datasphere, Signavio, or Kyma, IAS ensures your SSO setup just works, letting IT teams focus on business instead of identity headaches.

⚙️Configuring Attributes in IAS — Step-by-Step

Here’s how to set up each mechanism using the IAS Admin Console 🖥️:

1. 🟦 Configure Default Attributes (for Federation Enabled)

  • Navigate to IAS Admin Console → Applications.

  • Select your application (e.g., 📊 Datasphere).

  • Go to Trust → Assertion Attributes / Default Attributes.

  • Add Default Attribute:

    • Example: Groups = sac (hardcoded value)

    • Or map values: ${user.firstName}, ${user.company}

  • 💾Save and exit.
    (📄 Doc)

2. 🟩 Configure Enrich Assertion Attributes (for Federation Disabled)

  • Go to IAS Admin Console → Identity Providers → Corporate Identity Providers.

  • Select your corporate IdP (e.g., Microsoft Entra ID logo 🔵).

  • Open the Assertion Enrichment tab.

  • Add mapping rules:

    • Example: ${user.email} → emailAddress

    • Example: ${customAttribute1} → employeeNumber

  • 💾Save the configuration.
    (📄 Doc)

3. 🧪 Test and Validate

  • Use IAS’s Test tool 🧰 or a SAML tracer 🔍.

  • Confirm:

    • 🟦 Default Attributes appear with Federation Enabled.

    • 🟩 Enrich mappings appear with Federation Disabled.

📸Real-Life Example (Screenshot Placeholder) 

🏗️ Architecture: IAS as Proxy (OIDC ↔ SAML)

 BTP Application (BAS)
          │  (OIDC)
          ▼
   ┌──────────────────────────────┐
   │           SAP IAS            │
   │  ┌────────────────────────┐  │
   │  │   Application Side     │◄─┼─ Identity Federation Enabled
   │  │   (Default Attributes) │  │
   │  └────────────────────────┘  │
   │                              │
   │  ┌────────────────────────┐  │
   │  │ Corporate IdP Side     │◄─┼─ Identity Federation Disabled
   │  │ (Enrich Assertion Attr)│  │
   │  └────────────────────────┘  │
   └──────────────────────────────┘
          │  (SAML)
          ▼
   Corporate Identity Provider

Step-by-Step Explanation for Different Scenarios

Scenario 1: Enhancement of attributes coming from Identity provider.

Without Identity Federation Enabled

Users in IAS (user which we will use don't exist in IAS)

Identity fedration is disabled

And Enrich assertion attributes are not set. Expectation is - IAS should direct the Attributes coming from IDP to SAP BTP application(BAS in our scenario)

Perform Login Process to generate Assertion(from IDP) and JWT token(from IAS).

Enter Corporate IDP credentials -  User: idpuser@test.com

Login Successful to SAP BTP Application

In SAML assertion from IDP we can see - Groups are coming as part of SAML assertion.

When checked in Troubleshooting logs in IAS - We can see the same attributes.

Now in Corporate IDP - Enrich assertion attributes - to send Groups as Hogwarts_Groups to BTP application. In this scenario - Groups will be sent packaged as Hogwarts_Groups to Application which can be used for specific scenarios.

When we login - we can check in troubleshooting logs of IAS that expected attributes are sent.

Now when we enable Identity Fedration

Enable identity fedration - in corporate IDP -> identity fedration.

Now Enrich assertion attributes in Corporate IDP don't work - we will need to use another functionality called Default attributes in Applications in IAS. In below screenshot we can see that it didn't send any IDP attributes.

Now Setup Default attributes in IAS application as shown in below screenshot - make sure you select corporate IDP in drop down menu to send the attributes from Corporate IDP

Perform login to Application again

Now expected attributes are received by BTP application

Scenario 2: Sending Hardcoded values to Applications using IAS

When Identity Fedration is disabled

Perform it in Corporate IDP -> Enrich assertion attributes

Post successful login - we can check Hard coded values are sent to Application

Identity fedration enabled

IAS application -> Default Attributes -> Set Attrubtes

Post successful login - we can check that Hard coded values are sent to BTP application

🚀Why It Matters

  • 🔗Centralization: Handle diverse SAP SaaS attribute needs from one place.

  • 📈Scalability: Onboard new services without remapping custom attributes everywhere.

  • 🛠️ Maintainability: If tools change, update once in IAS—not in 5 different places.

Whether you’re setting up Datasphere 📊, Signavio 🟧, Kyma 🌀, or other BTP tools, IAS gives you a clean, unified way to tailor attributes—without touching your corporate IdP or apps.

                                                     ✨🦌🪄 Expecto Patronum 🪄🦌✨

                                                                                                              🌟🔮🧙‍♂️✨🧝‍♀️🌟
                                                                                    — may your SAP magic always shine bright!

entry.title: Re: This app is not enabled for key user adaptation
entry.content:
Hello @RaghavanKathamuthu 

Thanks for the update.

Two quick clarifications and a checklist to unblock you:

Key user extensibility is not the same as “Adapt UI (RTA)”. While many apps support Custom Fields & Logic (CFL), they do not support RTA. This is why you receive the message, "This app is not enabled for key user adaptation."

What you should do

Within CFL, set up your field in the right QM business context, select the Defect List/Object Page under UIs and Reports, and publish. The field will then appear under Extension Fields, with no need for RTA.

If visible but not editable: switch to Edit mode, verify that the status/page is changeable, ensure the field is not set to Read Only in CFL, and check that your role permits modifications. Clear cache and retest.

With regards

Chuma

SAP Help-Video Library for Extend and Integrate Your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

SAP Help-Adapting SAP Fiori UIs at Runtime - Key User Adaptation

SAP Help-SAP Extensibility Explorer for SAP S/4HANA Cloud

SAP Help-Extensibility Settings

entry.title: Re: Accelerating Adoption with WalkMe for SAP SuccessFactors HCM
entry.content: 'As a starting point for exploring the value of WalkMe, all SAP SuccessFactors customers will have access to a limited set of guided tours'  Can you share which guided tours are available to all, and which would be available with the actual purchase of the WalkMe solution?

entry.title: SAP SuccessFactors and Entra Integration - Issue
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I'm experiencing two different writeback errors when provisioning from Azure AD to SuccessFactors. Most users provision successfully, but a few are failing with these specific errors. Any guidance would be appreciated!

Issue 1: Regulatory Right to be Removed

An entry cannot not be provisioned in this target: SuccessFactors. The entry is 1xx92. The reason the entry cannot be provisioned is internal to that application. An example of why an entry cannot be provisioned is a user with a given public identifier, such as an email address, having previously exercised a regulatory right to be removed from the application.

Issue 2: Missing Required Properties

Error code: SuccessFactorsWritebackRequiredPropertiesMissing
Error message: Please add required properties in payload. Required property status is missing. You can check which properties are required for an entity in Admin Center > OData API Data Dictionary or the entity metadata. with the index 0

Thanks in advance for your help!

entry.title: Día 1 - Digital Drive: Desatando el Poder de SAP Cloud ALM para la Transformación Empresarial
entry.content:
Para aquellos que no tuvieron la oportunidad de asistir a nuestros eventos presenciales, estamos encantados de invitarles a nuestro próximo Digital Drive: Unleashing SAP Cloud ALM for Business Transformation MCLAC en formato webinar, que se llevará a cabo el 8 y 9 de octubre. Durante estos dos días, ofreceremos sesiones de una duración de 1 hora y 30 minutos cada una, comenzando a las 15h30 (BRT).

Registrese: [Webinar] Digital Drive: Unleashing SAP Cloud ALM for Business Transformation - MCLAC (Día 1 - Implementation)

Este evento está diseñado especialmente para proporcionar una visión integral sobre la gestión del ciclo de vida de las aplicaciones (ALM) y ofrecer las últimas novedades y tendencias en el campo. Estas sesiones son una oportunidad única para aprender de expertos y optimizar el uso de soluciones ALM en su organización.

Detalles del Evento:

  • Día 1 - Implementación: 8 de Octubre
  • Día 2 - Operaciones: 9 de Octubre
  • Duración de cada sesión: 1 hora y 30 minutos
  • Hora de inicio: 15h30 (BRT)

Requisitos previos:

Le solicitamos que complete los siguientes pasos antes de participar en el evento:

  1. Realice el proceso de activación de su tenant. Acceda al enlace para activar su SAP Cloud ALM (en caso de que aún no haya sido aprovisionado): https://me.sap.com/systemsprovisioning/provisioning.
  2. Cómo Solicitar SAP Cloud ALM en SAP for Me: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=axFjM01ZnU0.
  3. Recuerde el ID de usuario y la contraseña que se utilizaron para reclamar el tenant de SAP Cloud ALM y también para el cockpit del BTP.
  4. Enlace para acceder al cockpit del BTP: https://account.hana.ondemand.com/#/home/welcome.
  5. Verifique el correo electrónico de notification@sap.com para el enlace de acceso a su SAP Cloud ALM y próximos pasos.

Enlace para acceder a Configuración y Administración para SAP Cloud ALM - Configuración de la Fundación: https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-alm/setup-administration/enabling-api.

entry.title: Diferença de valores entre lançamento contábil (FB03) e Nota Fiscal (J1BNFE)
entry.content:
Olá pessoal!

Estou iniciando como SAP Funcional agora, e recebi o seguinte chamado:

Uma nota fiscal ficou com valor divergente do lançamento contábil na FB03.

Valor na J1BNFE: 91.000,00
Valor na FB03: 89.000,00
(valores fictícios representativos)

Após algumas investigações e contas, chegamos a conclusão que o problema foi que para o lançamento contábil foi considerado um Netprice do material atual, e para a Nota Fiscal foi considerado outro Netprice, do mes anterior.

A consulta dos Netprice foi feita na MM03 > Accounting 1 > Material Price Analysis, e considerando esses Netprice, os valores batem.

Não há edição de valor do material proximo a data dessa nota

Não encontrei algo que justifique o SAP considerar Net Prices diferentes para cada tipo de lançamento / cada Tcode...

O que posso pesquisar para justificar essa diferença?

entry.title: Re: How to set up FOC subcontracting process, without bot...
entry.content:
Hello @Deepika8 

Here’s the safe way in the public cloud to handle returnable (RTP) and non-returnable flows

Classic SD Returnable Transport Packaging (RTP) for the customer (no custom code)

Master data

Develop a packaging material with a type of LEIH and assign the item category group LEIH in the sales views. This enables deliveries to create RTP items with the specified item category TAL. SAP Help Portal-Returnable Packaging

Sales → Delivery

Create the normal delivery for your sellable material.

Pack using handling units or add the packaging material line; the system determines TAL for the packaging item.

Post goods issue (PGI)

On PGI, SAP automatically posts the packaging to the customer's special stock—this is how the system tracks what's on the customer's premises. SAP Help Portal-Generation of Delivery Items for Packaging Materials

Track packaging at the customer

Use standard stock Fiori Stock Overview (MMBE) to see special stocks, or your preferred inventory apps. SAP Fiori Apps Library

Return or charge

When packaging is returned, receipt brings stock back from customer special stock.

If not returned, create the normal billing for the RTP item via Create Billing Documents (Billing Due List). SAP Help Portal-Billing Due List Item

(Optional) You might want to consider automating the packaging of items through HU to make the process smoother.

From S/4HANA Cloud 2408, packaging items can be generated from assigned handling units; there’s also native integration to RPM if you need deeper tracking. SAP News Center-Unlocking the Potential of Intelligent ERP: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2408 Update

This “classic” RTP process (LEIH/TAL → customer special stock) is supported in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition. SAP Learning-Identifying SAP Solutions for Supporting Returnable Packaging Processes

When to opt for SAP Returnable Packaging Management (RPM)

Pick RPM if you need: multi-partner pool management, deposits/settlements, contract terms, kiosk/mobile scanning, and network-level analytics. RPM is a cloud application on SAP BTP with delivered integration to S/4HANA Cloud (content on SAP Cloud Integration). API-Identifying SAP Solutions for Supporting Returnable Packaging ProcessesSAP Help Portal

Mission and overview check SAP Discovery Center. Get started with SAP Returnable Packaging Management

Non-returnable packaging and incidental goods are provided with your purchase, and these items cannot be returned.

Treat as a normal sale: include/consume with the main product and bill in the standard SD flow (again via Create Billing Documents). SAP Help Portal-Billing Due List Item

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: DRC eDocument Cockpit - Message EDOCUMENT006
entry.content:
Hello @SebastianB 

EDOCUMENT006 occurs when the system is unable to create a new entry in EDOCUMENTHISTORY. Please verify the Sequence No. in the eDocument Status/History.

For 999: this is a hard limit by design, so further actions (such as cancel, void, or resubmit) are not possible. Please reverse the source document and create a new eDocument use Manage Billing Documents to cancel.

SAP Community-eDocument History reached sequence No. 999 – What now?

SAP Help Portal-Cancelling Billing Documents

If the value is below 999, stop any Schedule eDocument Jobs that are retrying the same document and try once more. If it still fails, raise an SAP incident (CA-GTF-CSC-EDO) with the eDocument GUID and screenshots; Support can correct the insert issue.

SAP Help Portal-Schedule eDocument Jobs - General  

SAP Support Portal-3595486 - Exception 'Error while inserting record into table EDOCUMENTHISTORY' in eDocument

For long-term housekeeping, you can SAP Help-Archive eDocuments with the archiving object EDOCUMENT.

Best regards,

Chuma

entry.title: Audit Report/Tracking of "Budget Override" Functionality
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We have identified the need for control and traceability in the “Budget Override” functionality within the Compensation module of SAP SuccessFactors. At the moment, we have not found an option to extract an audit report or track the changes/information recorded in this functionality.

Therefore, we would like to request:

1) Confirmation on whether the system provides any native report that allows auditing the use of the “Budget Override” functionality.
2) If not, whether there are any alternatives to perform this tracking, either via Ad Hoc, Stories, or through APIs.
3) Guidance on best practices to monitor and audit the information entered in Budget Override.

This tracking is essential for governance and internal audit purposes in our project, to ensure greater transparency in the budget management process.

Thank you in advance for your support, and we look forward to your guidance.

SAP SuccessFactors Compensation

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Re: Simulation Locked for editing
entry.content:
Hi Sanchia,

When an author edits a content object in Producer or Manager, they take editing control of that object.  In many instances, they also take editing control of the parent object being edited, which is likely a folder.  As soon as authors finish making changes to an object, they must give back editing control, i.e. Finish Editing the object, and also the parent object.  They should not retain editing control of objects that they are not editing because this prevents other authors from editing that content. 

You will not be able to modify the existing Simulation or create new Simulations in the folder until that current author gives back editing control of those objects.  Every author should do this every time.

If the author that has editing control of the Simulation and its parent folder is no longer available to give back editing control, an Administrator can cancel the current control that the author has over the objects.  To do this, the Administrator must click on the folder object in Manager and select More > Cancel Editing All Objects.  Be aware that this will result in the loss of the changes that have been made by the other author if those changes have not been synchronized to Manager.

Regards
Shane

entry.title: CBC Baseline Scopes vs. Manual Selection – What’s the Best Practice?
entry.content:
Hello Community,

We are currently running an SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (version 2508, Colombia localization) implementation project and have encountered the following situation:

  • During the configuration in Central Business Configuration (CBC), we advanced through the Fit-to-Standard workshops and proceeded to load the Finance scope items.

  • Upon validation, we noticed that some scope items selected in the DDA are no activated (e.g., 1GB, 1GF, 33M, 3M4, BGC) we find out that they were retired or absorbed into other processes.

  • When trying to load the scopes through a JSON file, the full Baseline gets re-activated. This includes scope items that are not needed for our specific business case.

Our questions are:

  1. Is it necessary or mandatory to always work with the full Baseline in implementation projects, even if it contains scope items that do not apply to the customer?

  2. What is the recommended approach in such cases?

    • Proceed with the Baseline including the “extra” scopes?

    • Or manually select only the scope items strictly required for the business?

  3. What is the best practice to avoid inconsistencies in CBC when loading/adjusting scopes via JSON, considering that this automatically re-activates the baseline?

We would greatly appreciate guidance from the community (or SAP directly) on the recommended way forward in these scenarios, as we want to ensure the configuration complies with the standard and avoids rework later on.

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Re: Dive into the future of SAP Universal ID and understand the changes underway
entry.content:
The introduction of SAP Universal ID was a significant improvement, especially with the ability to log in using a single email ID instead of remembering multiple S-User IDs. It greatly simplified access and improved efficiency.

However, with the recent changes, it has become challenging for users like us, who manage multiple partnerships as part of a central team and need to switch between 15+ S-User IDs regularly. This has now become a burden and, more importantly, a productivity downgrade.

It would be extremely helpful if SAP could reconsider this approach or provide an alternate solution—for example, allowing users to easily pick from multiple IDs that are clearly annotated during login. This would significantly improve usability and reduce friction for power users managing multiple accounts.

Thank you for considering this feedback.

entry.title: Re: SET UP PRIMARY FINANCE SETTINGS IN SAP CBC (Central B...
entry.content:
Hello @Melle1028 

Thanks for the clear questions. Here’s what is recommended for SAP S/4HANA Public cloud Edition (CBC):

Primary Fiscal Year Variant (FYV) in CBC

When you select K4 (calendar year, 4 special periods) in Specify Primary Finance Settings, it sets the FYV for the leading ledger (0L) across the entire system and cannot be changed after saving or posting. Choose K4 if your statutory or group reporting is done on a calendar-year basis. SAP Learning: Selecting Finance Settings and Building the Organisational Structure

 SAP Help Portal-Fiscal Year and Fiscal Year Variant

Academic-year reporting that may change year to year

Best option: retain K4 for 0L and model the academic year in analytics like CDS/report mapping months to academic periods. This sidesteps ledger constraints and allows you to adjust the mapping each year without altering core finance settings. (Conceptual best practice; CBC still uses the K4 system wide.

Non-leading ledger with an Alternative FYV 2L

It is technically feasible, but only if you assign the Alternative FYV before any postings in the company code or ledger. There are restrictions and dependencies you must review first. Use this option only if you genuinely need ledger-based accounting outside the standard calendar year. SAP Help Portal-Restrictions and Dependencies

Using FYV “SZ – Configurable template variant”

SZ is SAP’s template to define your own FYV (year-dependent). It’s the standard way to model non-calendar fiscal/academic years. Maintain the definition per fiscal year and do not change definitions for years with postings. If your legal/management year aligns with the academic calendar, you can select SZ as the primary FYV in CBC and maintain it each year upfront. SAP Help Portal-Defining Your Own Fiscal Year Variant

Practical recommendation

For legal or group reporting, if it's based on a calendar year, choose K4 as the primary and handle academic-year views in analytics.

Consider SZ as the primary option for year-dependent maintenance if legal and management reporting truly follow the academic year. Alternatively, use 2L with an Alternative FYV set up beforehand and validate the scope and limits

Help SAP documentation

Specify Primary Finance Settings (cannot be changed after saving; system-wide setting). SAP Learning-Selecting Finance Settings and Building the Organizational Structure

Fiscal Year and Fiscal Year Variant (overview and where FYV is set in CBC). SAP Help Portal-Fiscal Year and Fiscal Year Variant

Defining Your Own Fiscal Year Variant (use SZ template). SAP Help Portal-Defining Your Own Fiscal Year Variant

Alternative Fiscal Year Variant – Restrictions and Dependencies. SAP Help Portal-Restrictions and Dependencies

Alternative Fiscal Year Variant – Effects/assignment to local ledger. SAP Help Portal Alternative Fiscal Year Variant and Its Effects on Transactions

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Baseline scope items activation – how to prevent unwanted items
entry.content:
We are currently activating the required scope items for our project, but several scope items that we have already identified as not to be implemented are also being activated. Some of them, such as 1MC and 2LH, seem to be part of the baseline.

Is it possible to prevent these scope items from being activated, or does the baseline always need to remain fully active?

entry.title: Feasibility of showing a popup warning in standard Fiori app F298 when changes made through custom.
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

In the standard Fiori app Manage Memo Record (F298), the Company Code field has an F4 help. We have a requirement where, after a certain time (for example, post 7 PM), whenever a user selects a value from the F4 help, a popup warning message should be displayed on the Fiori side.

Since this is a standard app, custom changes have been made in the backend odata services I would like to know:

What is the feasibility of implementing this?
 How can this be handled

Has anyone implemented a similar scenario where custom popup logic is triggered in a standard app?

Any guidance or best practices would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Re: How to set different dispatch date for New and Change...
entry.content:
Hi Victor! 

Related to your last question:  no, you cannot configure this differentiation purely in OPD. I'd suggest to maintain two output types with a clear determination rule (if you have a way to flag new vs change).

entry.title: Re: SAP S/4 ABAP SAML2 SSO with Cloud Identity Services (BTP)
entry.content:
Hello,

So, I have a peculiar architecture here in my environment.
Our Fiori is standalone, and we configured SSO only for it. It connects via a trust relationship with S/4HANA.
We are using a Web Dispatcher to create an HTTPS endpoint to connect with IAS.
Accessing the app through the internal Fiori URL works, but without SSO because the URL is HTTP.
Accessing through the Web Dispatcher URL (HTTPS) without SSO enabled also works.
But when I enable SSO, it displays the error below When we try to use any Fiori application:

Is there any additional configuration I need to do for this scenario? I can't even click the "logon" button on this screen; it just gets stuck there.

entry.title: Re: SAP Business Data Cloud Series – Part 3: Customer-Managed Data Products
entry.content:
@PraveenJelli : check note: 3634421 - Replication Flow - transferring data failed due to error with object - SAP Datasphere

To resolve this, investigate the job log in SM37, SLG1,DHCDCMON,DHADM and ST22 for similar errors to identify mismatched elements. You may need to restrict the source with known filters, correct the target table's data types in SAP Datasphere, recreate the Replication Flow, and mark the existing target table as final. Better to raise a support ticket as this not the right platform, please use the support team 😀

entry.title: Re: How to use aggregated value of a Z Condition Type aut...
entry.content:
Hello Abul,

It's not possible to transfer the header value of ZPR1 to ZPMO by standard configuration. To achieve something close to this, you can use custom logic (BAdI for Alternative Calculation of Condition Amount) and set ZPMO's amount based on the value of ZPR1.

If you require ZPMO to also display a non zero rate (KBETR), then the implementation must calculate a rate using a defined base (for example, per 1 unit). Otherwise, you can map the aggregated header amount into the Condition Amount of ZPMO.

entry.title: Scope items included in DDA but not available in CBC – Guidance needed (S/4HANA Cloud Public 2508)
entry.content:
Hello Community,

We are currently working on an SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (release 2508, Colombia localization) project and have encountered an issue related to scope items availability:

During our Fit-to-Standard workshops and the Digital Discovery Assessment (DDA), the following scope items were included in our functional package:

  • 1GB – Asset Accounting with Group Ledger (IFRS)

  • 1GF – Assets Under Construction with Group Ledger (IFRS)

  • 33M – Revenue Recognition – Sell from Stock (IFRS)

  • 3M4 – Revenue Recognition – Service Documents (IFRS)

  • BGC – Fiori Analytical Apps for General Ledger

  • 2JB – SAP Fiori Analytical Apps for Financial Accounting

  • 1GI – General Ledger Allocation Cycle

However, when moving forward with the configuration in Central Business Configuration (CBC) and in Signavio Process Navigator, we noticed that these scope items are not available for selection.

This raises uncertainty on how to proceed, and we would like to ask the community for guidance:

  1. Have these scope items been officially retired in release 2508, and are their capabilities already integrated into other scope items (e.g., Universal Parallel Accounting, Universal Allocation, or Fiori analytical catalogs)?

  2. Is there any alternative procedure to enable them in CBC?

  3. If they have been replaced, what are the successor scope items or the best practice recommended to cover these functionalities in the project?

Our main goal is to ensure that the scope defined in DDA is properly reflected in CBC, without leaving functional gaps or including obsolete scope items.

Any guidance from the community (or SAP experts) on the best way forward would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Re: Audit Report/Tracking of "Budget Override" Functionality
entry.content:
Hi @rogercosta 

I must say I never use that feature since we can build dynamic budgets at employee level that roll up dynamically (hence capture everything correctly when an employee moves from one worksheet from another in terms of budget envelope and spent) and then allow top executives to exceed budget through executive review if they need to. Or create a separate budget only for executives.

I just looked into it and found this KBA:  https://me.sap.com/notes/2084180

 

Reporting on Overrides

There are a number of reports available to validate Variable Pay data. Go to: Admin Center> Compensation Home > Select correct plan > Plan Setup > Validation Reports.

 

I will try to turn it on later in my demo environment but maybe you can already look at this lead "Validation Reports".

 

Thanks

Xavier

Let
